title: Sanity
subTitle: Best for flexibility and design control
description: Sanity lets me fully customize the editing experience to match your site’s layout and needs. It's clean, fast, and easy to use once set up — you’ll only see what you need.

bulletPoints.text: Great for structured content like portfolios or blogs
Requires a free Sanity account to use

title: Contentful
subTitle: Great if you want a polished interface out of the box
description: Contentful has a modern dashboard and is easy to learn. It’s less customizable than Sanity but still works well for most content types.

title: WordPress
subTitle: Familiar and powerful if you've used WordPress before
description: WordPress is widely known and great for larger or blog-heavy sites. It offers tons of features, but can feel a bit clunky compared to the others.

bulletPoints.text: Great for managing lots of content
Can be slower or more complex to maintain
